com.opengamma.strata.finance

Interface Convention

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Bean, ImmutableBean
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FixedIborSwapConvention, FixedRateSwapLegConvention, FraConvention, IborFixingDepositConvention, IborIborSwapConvention, IborRateSwapLegConvention, TermDepositConvention

    public interface Convention
extends ImmutableBean
    A market convention.

    A convention contains key information that is commonly used in the market. For example, a USD LIBOR forward rate agreement (FRA) will have a day count convention of 'Act/360', spot date offset of T+2 and ISDA discounting.

    A convention is typically combined with additional information to form a Template, however this is not required. It is often possible to get a market price for a trade based on the template, however it is not possible to obtain a market price for a convention.

    Each implementation should provide a method with the name toTrade with whatever arguments are necessary to complete the trade. If there is an associated template, implementations should consider providing a method with the name toTemplate to provide the conversion.

    Implementations must be immutable and thread-safe beans.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface org.joda.beans.Bean

        metaBean, property, propertyNames
